description:
Golfers pair strategy and luck to go for the course record! Rolling through beautiful courses, players must decide whether to lay up and play it safe or roll the dice and attack a tight pin location.

The odds may be on your side, but will the dice be?

Fore's Wild is the most realistic golf tabletop game on the market, leaving you either ecstatic or infuriated.

Play a fast 18 holes solo or create a winner-take-all group tournament, it's all up to you! Take aim, roll your shot... FORE!

Play Monopoly with the greatest heroes and villains from the Marvel Universe! X-Men, Avengers, Fantastic Four; all famous Marvel characters are there. Play the game with one of six exclusive playing pieces, such as Sabretooth, Hawkeye of Captain America.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Brooklyn is one of the four original Crime Scene Games. It is a mystery solving game that combines three main elements:
1) A modern mystery story written by professional crime author Arttu Tuominen. 2) Finding details from a "Hidden image" picture. 3) More or less classic puzzle solving. The puzzles range from single to four card ones, and from light to quite heavy.
Players can use hints to help with the solving, but it costs them Reputation cards. Giving a wrong answer also makes the players lose a Reputation card.
The more Reputation Cards the players have left at the end, the easier it is for them to follow the "Hunch" found on the remaining cards, and ultimately choosing the correct option in the "Final Choice"
The high age recommendation comes from a few graphic details in the story. These can be skipped by parents playing with their children (12+), as long as they are aware such exist in the game.

Challenge Level 3/5

London is one of the four original Crime Scene Games. It is a mystery solving game that combines three main elements:
1) A modern mystery story written by professional crime author Arttu Tuominen. 2) Finding details from a "Hidden image" picture. 3) More or less classic puzzle solving. The puzzles range from single to four card ones, and from light to quite heavy.
Players can use hints to help with the solving, but it costs them Reputation cards. Giving a wrong answer also makes the players lose a Reputation card.
The more Reputation Cards the players have left at the end, the easier it is for them to follow the "Hunch" found on the remaining cards, and ultimately choosing the correct option in the "Final Choice"
The high age recommendation comes from a few graphic details in the story. These can be skipped by parents playing with their children (12+), as long as they are aware such exist in the game.

Challenge Level 3/5

Biblemoji is a fun and easy Christian game to play, connect, laugh, and talk about some main characters of the Bible, illustrated in emojis.

This game has more or less the same concept as the classic game of 7 Families, but with a few twists. 
There are 8 characters, so 8 families of 5 cards. Each family is a collection of 5 clues to guess the character of the Bible.

Gather 5 cards of the same family to complete a character of the Bible; gather the most families and you win the game! Ask strategically the cards you need. Observe the moves of other players to sabotage their game. Trick others (or yourself!) with the tricky-cards that may (or may not!) be in your favor!

This game is ideal for families and groups interested in the Christian faith, to have a fun time as well as learning opportunities about the Bible.

—description from the designer

We’re going back to where it all began. Following the Resident Evil 2 (2019) and Resident Evil 3(2021) board games, Resident Evil: The Board Game (2023) brings the sinister Spencer Mansion to the tabletop in a terrifying open world campaign. Based on the 2002 remake of the original Resident Evil video game, Resident Evil: The Board Game is a cooperative survival horror board game for 1-4 players.

Built on the survival horror engine of the previous two board games, Resident Evil: The Board Game introduces a slew of new and updated mechanics to keep you on your toes. Solve ingenious new puzzles to unlock doors, build the mansion map as you explore, send non-player characters on valuable missions, and more. Setup is swift because each scenario begins with just a few tiles. As you explore and open doors, you’ll build out the map, opening new pathways and discovering useful items… and deadly enemies.

Resident Evil: The Board Game is a campaign game playable over 27 hours, where every decision counts and has far-reaching consequences. Every resource must be managed, every bullet counted. Fighting isn’t the only way to survive. You’ll have to decide when to attack and when to flee. But you won’t always get a choice! As your campaign goes on, the mansion will evolve and the danger level will rise. The tension and encounter decks will change, adding mysterious new cards and altering the effects of old cards to make them even more dangerous. But effects don’t just happen over time. Tension cards can change enemy behaviours at any moment, making them more lethal from one turn to the next.

Short on time? Each Resident Evil: The Board Game scenario is also playable as a 60-90 minute one-shot, for bite-sized nightmare sessions.

In the darkness lie your fears. Can you fight them and survive?

A tile placing game.

To win in competition mode, you've got to place a tile adjacent to the tile where the wanderer stands, then decide to move the wanderer to one of the new tiles or let him stay. This way you can choose to move it where the next player can't take a turn.

To win cooparative, you got to lay down all tile in game (move the wandere to where the next player can place a tile).

The rules are pretty simple but nice with children so they learn to plan forward (or learn playing at all).

A highly strategic boxing game for 2 players. Predict your opponent's moves to get the KO!

1-2 Punch is an easy-to-learn strategic boxing card game that is easy to learn, but difficult to master. Similar to other abstract strategy games, 1-2 Punch rewards experienced players as they continue to play and hone their skills.

Both players strategically play two cards per round; one for their first action and another for their second action. Reveal and resolve the cards played for each action based on timings shown on each card. Execute your plan to land the perfect punch to exhaust your opponent and break their guard.

With only 24 cards and no board, 1-2 Punch can be played anywhere!

Word Turners is a fun alphabet playing card game for 2-6 players, with the simple aim 'who can make the longest word?'It is a game for the whole family and has no time consuming set up, just shuffle and play. There are 60 cards in pack 1 instruction card, 2x 26 alphabet cards and introducing the choice card for which there are 7!

Simply shuffle the cards and deal 7 cards per player, then everyone looks at their cards and decides how many if any to swap, you only get one chance to swap so choose wisely! The choice cards can be any letter you choose! Then when everyone is ready they turn their cards to reveal their word. If there is a draw symbols on  cards come in play.

The player with the longest word wins the hand. In the event of a tie, the person with the highest scoring word wins.

Cuinze is a shedding game of luck, memory, skill and strategy. It is a competitive game: be the first to play all of your tiles and you WIN! At game's end, players are ordered from first place to last place. As long as you are in the top half of all players, you are still a winner! It is fast-paced: there is little waiting between turns, and a game normally ends within 10 minutes. Rules are straightforward and easy to learn. The game teaches young children how to track and sequence numbers, recognize patterns, assess probabilities, and develop strategies: the game avoids use of face cards that impede learning of numbers. It is family friendly (ages 8 and up) - adults will not dominate! It is great for groups: an unlimited number of players (with more boxes) can easily play together in one giant game. Freestanding tiles provide a satisfying tactile experience; no racks are needed and no more fumbling to hide cards.
A bundled set of the UNO Stacko dexterity game and the UNO card game.

Docentis is a game where you become a PE teacher whose goal is to plan an innovation project for the class. For that purpose, you will have to meet your students’ specific needs, manage playground spaces, consider meteorology, defective material, internship students and all kind of contingencies that may affect your planning. You may need to take care of the students during their break, substitute another teacher or respond to a headmaster’s request. Will you finish the day exhausted, or will you have some energy left for teacher’s training after class? Will you be able to carry out your dreamed project?

The goal is to obtain the highest score amongst all the players by obtaining the different parts of each project. Some of them are:
-    Curricular elements: educational goals, skills, contents, and evaluation.
-    Methodological elements: teaching styles and pedagogical models.
-    Teacher cards from other subjects’ colleagues, training courses or school trips.

Players will take turns to discover the school facilities in the game board, trying to obtain their project’s element cards. 
Energy will be the currency of exchange to get the elements and will increase or decrease during the course of the game.

At the end of the 6th shift (6th hour of class), a count will be made of the elements achieved (+2) and those that remain to be achieved (-1). The one with the highest score will be the winner of the game.

In its educational version, once the game is over, the elements obtained can be used to develop a real case study.


Docentis es un juego en el que te convertirás en docente de Educación Física que debe planificar un proyecto de innovación para su clase. Para ello, deberás atender a las necesidades específicas de tus estudiantes, gestionar los espacios del patio, tener en cuenta la meteorología, el material defectuoso, la llegada de los estudiantes de prácticas y otras muchas situaciones que acontecen en el transcurso del día que dificultarán o facilitarán tus planes (recreos, sustituciones, avisos de dirección, etc.) ¿Terminarás agotado al finalizar el día o te queda energía para un curso de formación? ¿Serás capaz de lograr el proyecto soñado?      El objetivo del juego es convertirte en la persona que consiga la máxima puntuación, que estará determinada por la obtención de los diferentes elementos que componen cada proyecto. Algunos de ellos son:
-    Elementos curriculares: Objetivos, competencias, contenidos y evaluación
-    Elementos metodológicos: Estilos de enseñanza y modelos pedagógicos
-    Además de cartas de profesorado de otras materias, cursos de formación o excursiones.

Turno a turno, las personas que juegan recorrerán por el tablero las diferentes instalaciones de su centro educativo consiguiendo distintas cartas de elemento que componen su proyecto. Su energía será la moneda de cambio que deberán gestionar durante toda la partida. Ahora bien, la limitación de recursos y espacios generarán encuentros y sinergias entre compañeros de departamento que se verán obligados a cooperar si quieren alzarse con la victoria. 
Todos aquellos elementos conseguidos otorgarán puntos positivos y aquellos que no se logren puntuarán en negativo. Cuando el día lectivo haya finalizado, si eres el profesor que más se acercó al proyecto planificado… ¡ganarás la partida! 
En su versión educativa, una vez finalizado el juego se puede utilizar el resultado de la partida para desarrollar un supuesto práctico real con los elementos conseguido. Sin duda, un interesante serious game para futuros docentes.

In 1974, the band The Meeples broke up during the recordings for the "Vinil" album. The A-side of the unfinished album quickly became cult-followed by fans and critics around the world, turning into one of the most intriguing legends of rock-and-roll history. Fifty years later, the band has finally reunited to finish the B-side with the help of a team of the best musical producers in show biz. That's you!

In HiFi, players start their turn by spinning the record's rondel on the turntable to choose an action within their reach, or they can spend production points to achieve one of the other actions. After resolving these actions, players allocate audio cards to the five studio tracks, earning points based on the buttons in that producer's equalization track and what's in the studio track. When a player allocates a guitarist card, each player who collaborated with the equalization of the guitar earns points. When elements such as sound wave or time-track positions match, players can perform bonus actions.

Each round represents a song recorded on the A-side of the album that will help players gather information to aid B-side recordings. After listening to all of the songs on the A-side — 6-8 rounds depending on the player count — the game ends. Whoever contributed most effectively to the construction of the tracks on the album's B-side wins.

Roll the Dice! Open Padlocks! Get Goals! Avoid challenges!

CanDados is a fun game of cards and dice,a push your luck game in which you must manage to open the padlocks of your objectives in order to obtain the score they contain.

Use the action of the special dice to achieve your objectives or annoy your opponents.

Get target cards by rolling the dice. Only one target per turn

On your turn, roll the 5 dice and try to get one of your target cards in 3 rolls. You can roll the number of dice you want in each roll, setting aside the dice that you want to keep, these dice can be re-rolled in the next pending rolls. At the end of your rolls, you can set aside a die with a 1 and then perform its special action (The removed die will not count towards your objective).

Special challenges may also help you get target cards.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.



¡Lanza los Dados! ¡Abre Candados! ¡Consigue Objetivos! ¡Evita desafíos!CanDados es un divertido juego de cartas y dados en el que deberás conseguir abrir los candados de tus objetivos para poder obtener la puntuación que encierran.

Usa la acción de los dados especiales para lograr tus objetivos o fastidiar a tus adversarios.

Consigue cartas objetivo tirando los dados. Un único objetivo por turno.

Gana el jugador que más puntos obtenga al final de la partida.

Lanza los 5 dados e intenta conseguir una de tus cartas objetivo en 3 tiradas. Puedes lanzar el número de dados que desees en cada tirada, apartando los dados que quieras guardar, dichos dados pueden volver a relanzarse en la siguientes tiradas pendientes. Al finalizar tus tiradas puedes apartar un dado con un 1 y posteriormente realizar su acción especial (El dado apartado no contará para tu objetivo). Ver dados especiales para saber sus acciones.

This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

The golden wedding of the Countess von Donnerswarth was to be an epoch-making event. A remote, noble hotel, exquisite guests and, to top it off, a banquet at which the countess would display her husband's gift: the legendary Ramanpur diamond. But that same night the precious gem inexplicably disappears from your hotel safe.
Who among the guests knew the safe combination? Who had access to the crime scene? Who has usurped the gemstone unnoticed?

Find the decisive clues in this circumstantial case and convict the thief or the thief of the diamond of Ramanpur.

This game can be played independently of "Das Bankett - Teil 2"

You wake up on a desolate island, your clothes are soaked & the last thing you remember is looking out your ships’ deck as a storm tossed it about in the ocean. Far to the east of the island, you see your cargo of colourful rafts gently nudging the shore. The adventurer in you awakens!

On your turn each player gets 3 actions: Dice Roll, Path Bending and Movement. Based on the colours rolled on the first action the player can choose rafts for the next action where they place and remove rafts from anyones path. The player can either move free to a raft of the same colour or roll a Draft to move to a raft of another colour. Attack other players by rolling any colour doubles and skip a raft on double draft.

Create your own path by building, breaking & jumping across the colourful rafts to make your way back to the Shore. The first player to reach shore wins the game!

Roll the dice to test your luck in this sweet and brutal game.

This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

The Carabinieri of Catanzaro need your help: The notorious Tegano Mafia family controls the city and the entire province. But with the death of the eldest son, there is a unique opportunity to put an end to their trade forever.

In this puzzle game, you will receive a case file with evidence, documents and all kinds of clues. Analyze bills, parking tickets, newspaper articles, autopsy reports and much more in order to convict the perpetrator. Use tools like social media profiles and websites to identify motives and check alibis.

Can you solve the case?

- Case files based on real criminal cases
- Interactive elements
- Use other exciting sources such as the Internet
- Put your analytical skills to the test
- Work with your friends

The game consists of 100 cards with 200 questions, an answer book and 10 joker cards, of which the TV game hosts - ArÅ«nas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - will give the players fun QR tasks. You can compete one on one or form teams and embark on a real intelligence fight.
The game begins with the first round of cards (101 to 150 cards and with 5 joker cards) to be shuffled and folded on the table. Cards are drawn in turn, questions are read aloud. If the game is a team based, team members can consult with each other. Answers are checked by the opponent or the opposing team. After playing the first round, the second is played on the same principle (from 151 to 200 cards and with 5 joker cards).
1 point is awarded for the correct answer. For proper performance of the joker's task - 3 points. For transferring a joker card to another player (or team) without reading the QR code - 0 points. After scanning the QR code of a missed task, 1 point is deducted. The participant or team with the most points wins.

The cards can be used as a stand-alone game or as an expansion for "Golden Mind: a great board game". Also, this game can be expanded with "Golden Mind. Start No. 1" cards.

This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

It should have been a happy and conciliatory card game: Six people meet on an island in the tranquil Bad Leckersmoor to spend a sociable evening together. But in the end one of them is dead.

Those present are all valued members of the community: some work on the local council, some are important industrialists.

The law firm entrusted with the estate of the deceased senses inconsistencies and asks you for help.

Created from a love of both climbing and card games, Crux is a simple yet strategic game to play. The concept is to draw cards to complete your problem while preventing your opponents from doing the same.

Meeple Company is a strategic worker placement boardgame in which you will have to play your meeples wisely to accomplish your company's three objectives.

You will be able to choose between four types of companies: the laboratory, the toy factory, the robotics company and the chocolate factory. The objectives to be achieved will be the following:

To have a single meeple of your presidency.
To have the highest number of meeples in your main department
To have no prohibited meeples in your company.

To achieve this, you will be able to perform 4 different actions:

Hire: you choose a meeple from those located in the center of the table and place it in your Hall.
Move: you choose one of your meeples and send it to a rival's Hall.
Send to a Congress: you choose a meeple from your work area or from the center of the table and everyone must remove a meeple of that color from their company.
Close: you close your company for this day, you will not be able to perform any more actions or receive any more meeple. The meeples of your Hall go to your work area.

A KINGDOM IS YOURS FOR THE TAKING!

Includes color counters and Battle Boards
Your troops are tired and slowly giving ground. They've fought hard all day against an infinite number of enemy troops. They've done all that you've asked of them and more. They've covered themselves with both blood and glory and look to you for victory.

The fate of your nation hangs in the balance as you desperately search for that one spot to launch your final attack. There! Gathering your personal horsemen, you draw your sword for it is now or never. The battle rests on your strong right arm.

Warrior Heroes – To Be King! is set in the mythical world of Talomir and is compatible with our Fantasy RPG, Warrior Heroes – Adventures in Talomir. Talomir is a land where dozens of Nations vie for dominance and like other games, we've provided you with Army Lists that describe your troops and how to assemble them for Battle. Other games allow for fighting individual Battles, but we've taken it farther, much farther.

We’ve added a simple to use, fast play Campaign System that ties all your Battles together to insure that every Battle means something. With the Warrior Heroes – To Be King! Campaign System, you are the Commander of the Army one minute and the King, or Queen, the next.

And best of all; you can play solo, cooperatively against the game, or competitively, head to head.
Do you have what it takes to be King?

–Description from the publisher

The Tech Connect Card Game is an educational game to teach the concepts of the NASA Home and City website (homeandcity.nasa.gov), namely that there are many technologies that NASA developed that help in many parts of society.  It was distributed for free at various events hosted by NASA.

The game is a deck of cards in shrinkwrap and with a cardboard stiffener. Besides the cover and rules cards, there are 12 Target Cards for aspects of life in Home and City (Bedroom, Bathroom, Living Room, Kitchen, Outside; Air Travel, Automotive, Coastal, Grocery, Manufacturing, Medical, Sports), and 48 Tech Cards about various technologies derived from NASA R&D (e.g. UV-blocking glasses, freeze-dried technology, digital cameras, countertop gardens, self-driving farm vehicles), each with a couple of paragraphs of description.

Players take turns being the judge. The judge reveals the top of the Target Card deck. Each other player chooses one of the six Tech Cards in their hand which they think best impacts the revealed target area.  The judge chooses which is the best fit; players can try to persuade the judge why their choice is best.  The player whose Tech Card the judge chooses keeps the Target Card, players draw to replace the Tech Cards played, and the next player is the judge for the next round. The player with the most Target Cards after they are all distributed is the winner.

The Brittany War of Independence 1487-91 simulates the conflict between the Kingdom of France and the Duchy of Brittany. The war ended with the defeat of the Britons and the marriage of the Duchess Anne to the King of France Charles VIII, sealing the annexation of the Duchy to the kingdom. This game is part of the Gold and Steel series which allows the campaigns of the late 15th and early 16th centuries to be played on a strategic and tactical scale. A combatant counter represents respectively 1,500 to 2,000 pedestrians and 750 to 1,000 riders on the front and half on the back. One artillery counter represents a hundred guns - of all types and calibers.

The game is played over 13 turns corresponding to a season (spring, summer, autumn), the winter turn is not played.
The game puts the French camp in opposition to the Breton camp between which the great Breton lords evolve between betrayal and loyalty; Laval, Rieux Rohan.
This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map. All fighters of this period, such as knights, mercenaries (English bowmen, Gascon crossbowmen, German lansquenets and Swiss pikes), bowmen, billmen, pikes, early arquebusier, country militia, etc., fight on a tactical map featuring a typical XVth century battleground The ambience of that period is added with tactical chits played during the combat rounds (cannon battery, charge, cut and thrust, dismounted knights, ditch, fence, harassment shots, raining arrows) and events such as rain, no fight or betrayal, no wing deployment.
The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ Kingdom of France
1) Reinforcement, replacement
2) strategic move
3) attrition phase
4) combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Duchy of Brittany
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
Check for victory


    5 of the Gold & Steel series

Do you want to become a dentist and run your own dental clinic? Then, this is your very special game, whether you’re a student or actually a… real dentist. Equip the clinic, hire the best team you can have and let the fun begin.

The Dentist Game, an ideal way to spend your free time and socialize with your friends while you learn new things about dentistry in a more easy and enjoying way. At the very beginning of the game, you have to choose the level of the location interior and waiting room as well as your team of technicians, assistants, students and the starting tools, consumables. After you have put in place all those aspects, you start to upgrade your estates, until you reach the maximum level of 3 for each part of them.

Your managing and economical skills are used to a full extension in this “venue”, so you have all the tools in order to not worry that you have lost your time by the time you get to $10000 (For Your Information: You start with $2000 in your bankroll and the winner is decided by that one person who manages to get to the $10k mark). Time management is also a key factor in this game, so you have to be careful with your game plan, because times means money, right?

Minimum number of required players for the game to be played in a proper way: 2.

Durability of a game that involves at least 4 players: 30 minutes to 1 hour of play-time.

“Iran active intervention into the sphere of relations between the Soviet Union and other socialist countries, its reiterated attempts to incite unrest in the Caucasian regions, its fanatical refusal to put an end to the prolonged conflict with Iraq, leave the Union of the Soviet Socialist Republics no other choice than the use of military force.”

Public Declaration of State Committee on the State of Emergency in the U.S.S.R.
Moscow June 28, 1985


1985: Sacred Oil covers the Soviet offensive in the Persian Gulf area, today recognized as the prelude to World War Three. Initially limited to Soviet Union, Iran and Iraq, the conflict quickly extended to other Arab countries, US and finally NATO and Warsaw Pact.

The complex Middle East political situation, the logistic problems and the distances involved are only some of the challenges both sides must face. Soviet Union must avoid an early full mobilization of the West, while United States and its allies must interpret Kremlin's real intents and react in an appropriate manner.

As in the other 1985 modules, every aspect of a modern conflict is covered in detail. Sacred Oil raises the stake by having no fixed Order Of Battle and a field of action encompassing the whole globe.

				
				
					Game Components
    44 pages Rules Booklet    
    40 pages Scenarios/Designer's notes Booklet
    16 pages "Operational Procedure" Booklet (Full play examples, Developer's notes)
    2 identical Tables booklets - 12 pages
    8 Displays (A4 size)
        Iran Bases
        Iraq Bases
        US faction bases
        Soviet faction bases
        US faction Naval
        Soviet faction Naval
        2 identical Air Superiority Areas
    
    6 Operational Maps, covering Southwest Asia from USSR Caucasian Republics to Oman and from Baghdad to the Strait of Hormuz:
        99x62 cm (I, K, M, P)
        43.6x62 cm (J)
        38x45.4 cm (L)
    
    1 Line of Communication Map (84.5x46 cm), covering the whole globe with 4 tracks
    80 Event Cards, used for mobilizing forces, diplomatic actions and special operations (Soviet faction E01 to E34, E50 to E53; US faction E01 to E40, E50 to E52).    
    7 countersheets (280 counters on each), representing US, USSR, UK, France, Iran, Iraq and other countries forces.
    2 20-Sided Dice


				
				
					Game Highlights
    Order of Battle and TO&E are not “generic”, but set exactly in June, 1985
    No predetermined OOB: everything depends by the political and strategic decisions taken by both sides
    14km per hex, 48 hours per game turn
    Division / Brigade / Battalion sized ground combat units
    Special Forces, Airmobile, Paratroops, Electronic Warfare, Artillery, SSM, SAM and Air Defense Artillery units
    Squadron sized Air and Helicopter units
    Extensive air war rules covering Escort, Intercept, SEAD, Wild Weasel, Ground Strike and more
    Surface Ships and Submarines, from single flag ships to groups of fast patrol missile boats    
    Realistic but flowing naval rules. Everyone here remembers the horror of TNW’s 12-turns naval phase
    Specific operational tactics like Single-Echelon Assault and Active Defense
    Tension period, where both sides mobilize their forces and try to gain allies in the region
    Six different scenarios of increasing complexity:
        And It Became Blood: USS CV-63 Kitty Hawk operations to shut down Soviet bases in Ethiopia and South Yemen
        Behold a Great Red Dragon: The initial Soviet offensive in Northern Iran
        And the Sea Gave Up the Dead: Soviet and US Forces clash for the control of Bandar Abbas    
        The Whore of Babylon: The July 1985 Iraqi offensive, taking advantage of a collapsing Iranian army
        Gog and Magog: The full Persian Gulf campaign, from the initial growing tension to the final global conflict
        To Shatter the Old World: Under an Iron Sky + Deadly Northern Lights + Sacred Oil combined campaign. Nothing can be worse.
    
    Playable stand-alone or in combination with 1985:Under an Iron Sky and 1985: Deadly Northern Lights.


(description from the publisher and BGG user)

18Kit is a modular game designed to scale based on the number of players and choosen lenght of play. Players aim to make the most money by buying and selling stock in different corporation; those entities, conversely, are operated by players and may lay track, place stations, run and buy trains, and distribute returns to its shareholders.
While most 18xx rely on a detailed historical background which shapes the map and companies' starting locations in a fixed way, 18Kit is completely ahistorical and consequently much more flexible.
18Kit features a modular map with up to 7-hex tiles, a "game chart" that defines all aspects of setup depending on player count and bank size, like number of trains, map tiles, available company types.
The game feature a unique ribbon-style hex stock market, which is a variation on the classic 2D stock market.
Other than that, the game is an incremental cap 18xx with minor companies, price protection à la 1870 and 2:1 mergers (systems).
It ends when a player goes bankrupt or the bank breaks, and the winner is the richest non-bankrupt player, taking in account personal money and value of their own shares.

The first place winner of the 2021 Zenobia Awards, Tyranny of Blood models the rise and fall of British colonialism in India from 1750 to around 1947, and the ensuing social displacement—in the religious, military, economic, and labor domains—that still resonate today. The game seeks to answer the lofty questions: how do classes with disparate bases of power work together in a society, how do they struggle against each other, and who are the victims of this process?

In this asymmetric card-driven game, each player plays as one of the four major caste groups (Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Shudra/Dalit) with the end goal of shaping the coming independent Indian nation-state to support their interests while dealing with their unique and unequal places in the hierarchy. Each faction has its own role to play in the game and its own method of earning victory points based on its distinct goals.

In this game, the British are not a playable faction, but a non-player force that players will have to respond to, either by fighting against colonial forces, or working with them to oppose the other players.

Designer note: Tyranny of Blood is about a hierarchical system that has oppressed people throughout history and has lingering effects that continue to cause suffering today. The game is meant as a condemnation of the system and a method of understanding it, not an endorsement or celebration. I hope that learning about this history will inspire players to think critically about the inequalities that plague the world today, and to struggle against them.

In Insight: The Elements, players identify a matching chemical element between two cards.  The periodic table is divided into four blocks (s,p,d,f), each with its own set of cards.

In competitive mode, players aim to find as many matches as they can, as fast as possible.  The fastest and most accurate player wins.  In cooperative mode, players work together to either play all of their cards (laid-back version) or to discard the fewest total cards (strategic version).

The cards are double-sided, allowing for varied difficulty.  One side of each card contains a list of element symbols and their names.  The flip side shows a graphic of a block of the periodic table, with valid elements highlighted.

First Punic War 264 to 241 BC is a two-player wargame of the first great military clash between the Roman Republic and the Carthaginian Empire, spanning 24 years in the 3rd century BC. At this time, Rome controlled a federation of states in Italy, while Carthage was the major power of the Western Mediterranean. The war was centered around the island of Sicily, but also saw campaigns in Sardinia and North Africa, with the possibility for more operations elsewhere around the region.

Each game turn (GT) represents three years. Each hex is 40 miles across. Roman combat units represent legions plus attached cavalry (4000 to 5000 men) and groupings of auxiliaries (1000 or more men). Carthaginian units represent groups of various troop types representing 1000 to 10,000 men. Naval units represent about 50 warships each. Leaders represent an inspirational to competent commander plus a guard.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map, 176 5/8-inch counters.

Published in S&T #336

Russian Boots South: Conquest of Central Asia The game system is based on the previously published S&T games: They Died with Their Boots On, Volumes 1 & 2, Julian, and Sepoy Mutiny.

Russian Boots is a two-player wargame simulating the Russian conquest of Central Asia during the 1850s to 1890s. There are two opposing players: Russian Empire and Khanates. The Russian Empire player represents the theater command of an autocratic empire. The Khanate player represents the various independent kingdoms and tribes of the region, with the possibility of intervention from forces on the periphery. Victory conditions are asymmetrical, with the Russians trying to conquer Central Asia and the Khanates trying to prevent this.

There are three scenarios, each representing a different situation. Each game turn (GT) represents a from one to six years, depending on the pace of operations. Each hexagon on the map represents 80 to 90 kilometers (53 miles). Each Russian unit represents one or two battalion-sized grouping of companies or squadrons. Other units represent brigade or division-sized units, along with corresponding logistics, as well as groupings of tribesmen or other fighters ranging between 1000 to 5000 fighters. Generals represent key commanders, their staffs, and an elite guard.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters.

Published in S&T #338

Return to Europe: Sicily & Italy July–Nov 1943 is a Strategic level board-wargame of the Allied invasion of Sicily and Southern Italy. The operation was viewed as only a limited offensive to secure the Mediterranean and force Italy out of the war. The Germans also intended only a limited effort to delay the Allies while a strong defense was established at the far North of the peninsula. Both sides scented greater possibilities in the early going and were drawn into what would become a grueling and expensive campaign.

Using a modified version of rules from Desert Fox Deluxe, one player or team of players commands the Allied forces, the other the Axis. In general terms the Allies are trying to knock Italy out of the war and seize the greatest amount of territory as possible, while the Axis seeks to maintain control of Italian territory for the maximum amount of time.

Each game turn represents one month with up to six player impulses in each game turn.

There are two scenarios, but only the campaign scenario included in the printed rules. The second scenario is included in the PDF version of the rules located at the Decision Games website in the E-Rules section for Strategy & Tactics magazine. http://strategyandtacticsmagazine.com/site/e-rules/

Originally published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #341 - Jul-Aug 2023.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 month
Hex: 6.7 miles / 10 kilometers
Units: Company to Regiment

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-10 hours

Note: Players will need to provide two 6-sided die for game play.

Operation Albion: Germany versus Russia in the Baltic, 1917-1918 is a two-player operational wargame of the campaign in the Baltic, 1917-18, in which the Germans captured the city of Riga and took critical islands in an amphibious operation. Operation Albion in part led to the collapse of the Russian Provisional Government and brought the final German victory in the East. The campaign was one of the few joint land-naval-air operations of World War I. The game includes the post-Albion German intervention in the Finnish Civil War of 1919.

Albion is a combined naval-air-land campaign. Players conduct actions which encompass discrete combat, logistical, intelligence, and other operations. A player can conduct one or more actions per turn. All units in the game use a similar combat system, showing the interaction of naval, air, and land forces. Each game turn represents from one day to one month depending on the pace of operations. A player may take multiple actions each GT. One inch on the map represents 40 kilometers. Ground units represent regiments, brigades, and divisions, or equivalent formations. Aircraft units represent squadrons. Ship units represent divisions of one to three battleships or battlecruisers, four to eight other cruisers, flotillas of twelve to twenty destroyers, or various numbers of other ships types.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters

Published in S&T #342

An infectious card game where players fight for a cure and outlast the other players!

Game setup takes roughly 2 minutes. A game of max panic after understanding the simple mechanics takes between 20-30 minutes.

Each player must use the cards in the deck to their advantage. There are 3 card times players must use. Advantage, Protective Gear, and Exposure cards.

Each player has a maximum hand size of 3 cards and will draw one card, play one card each turn. Expose other players to the virus, or give yourself an advantage!

The game is won by having all 3 cure cards or infecting your opponents to 10 Infection Counters.

In Molly House, players take the roles of the gender-defying mollies of early eighteenth century London. Throw grand masquerades and cruise back alleys while evading moralistic constables who seek to destroy your community. Be careful, there may even be informers in your midst!

Players draft hands of vice cards representing the different gestures, desires, and encounters that were frowned upon by the Society for the Reformation of Manners, a citizen group that sought to stamp out any behavior it deemed deviant in late 17th and early 18th century London. These cards allow players to host festivities with the help of their fellow mollies and create joy. But, those same cards can also lead players to be arrested and to the ultimate ruin of the molly house.

As players encounter the Society’s enforcers, they will often have to pay bribes or may be coerced into becoming informers for the Society. Informers must try desperately to undermine the community around Mother Clap’s Molly House without being discovered by their fellow mollies.

Johnny, Corey, Danny and Barney are at the start for the big farmland race. The course is laid out, everyone has their race tableau, a figure and six tiles. You roll the dice - depending on the result, you place a tile on the diced number on your own tableau and move the figure accordingly - if the number is already occupied, you sit out - or choose a number or move to the next hay bale. Instead of rolling the dice, you can make numbers occupied by tank tiles available again. The player who crosses the finish line for the second time wins.

Dragons of the Black Baron are approaching Knight's Land, the four heroes Ruby, Twinkle, Alex and Gene together with the chameleon collect the equipment. Chips are laid out, around them the Super 4 trays. You roll the dice - for an item you have to hit it with the flicked chameleon, you use a hit alien as a joker; if the chameleon touches a dragon you have to put a dragon chip on a Super 4 tray; if you win an item, you put it on the matching tray; if there is a dragon, it is removed. If there is a dragon on all the trays, the Black Baron has won.

Help Isis resurrect her slain husband, Osiris and defeat the chaos and destruction of Set.

Solo player micro-roll & write playable in less than 10 minutes. Easy Difficulty.

This game was an entry in the 2017 Solo Game Contest.

In the multiplayer roll and write game Aban!, your goal is to completely plant your garden and score the highest number. In each round, you roll dice in the center of the table, determining what plants are available to all players. You have to draw these paths on your player sheets to create combos between plants and sabotage the garden of the other players. You will be trying to optimize the available symbols better than your opponents.

Aban! Comes with double-sided cards and different effects that add new unique strategies to your games. In addition, the different cards and variability in the dice can be animated and make every game different. Aban! Allows you to play from 2 to 5 players.

Similar to Guess Who?, but with full length characters carrying various items. One of the characters is selected, and players take turns asking questions to try to guess which one.

From the publisher: There are 50 characters to choose from. Players compete to be the first to guess which one is pictured on The Who is Who card in play. As questions are asked and answered, characters can be removed from the board, narrowing the choices.

In the advanced rules players don’t remove characters from the board.

A quick and light RPG style card game where the player builds up their character, gaining powers and equipment, over the course of facing down a series of rivals. It can be played solo, cooperative, or competitive with nothing more than a set of playing cards and two six-sided dice per player.

In SPARTA! command Athenians or Spartans in a battle to rule the Greek world.

Achieve dominance and control valuable regions that grant unique benefits - be it the wealth of Sicily, the fleets of Corinth, or alliances with larger cities like Thebes or Syracuse to provide fresh recruits for battle. You might even rally the Persians and Macedonians to your side.



Command The Conflict!
March armies and sortie fleets to raid enemy territories. Siege valuable cities, and engage your foes in fierce battles. Steel your nerves when you enter the fray of battle, as it is bloody and swiftly resolved using an elegant card-based system.



Who Will Head Your Efforts?
Lead your forces with legendary characters such as Pericles and Cleon. Each leader has a unique ability, be it combat prowess or cunning diplomacy.
Characters may become experienced— flipping the leader to their upgraded form with a more powerful ability.



Meet your foes on the bloody battlefield
Balance diplomacy, economy, and military might in this card-driven game of historic conflict!

The Splendour Of Greece Is Yours For The Taking!




SPARTA! is for 1-2 players (SOLO bot is included) & plays in 2-3 hours.

Includes all of these historical scenarios:
 - First Peloponnesian War 
 - Second Peloponnesian War
 - Theban/Spartan War 
 - Cleomenian War

One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Wander through the wonderful landscapes of the old continent and get to know the culture of the countries!

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

The child can take the first steps in the wonderful world of math and playfully learn the realm of numbers.

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

A fast-paced, competitive game for friends and families.
This is a reimplentation of Knock Knock, but with fewer suits and a bit less take-that. It is, as described, a family game to be played with kids. 
The remainder of the description is via the publisher's description of Knock Knock:
In this card game players compete to be the first to get rid of their hands.
Like other card shedding games, play proceeds as players discard matching the suit or value of the previously discarded card.
Various special cards also add fun and silly elements such a slapping, nose touching and moose antlers.

A mighty artifact is hidden in a forgotten Temple. An obscure spell makes it unreachable. The only way to break this arcane magic is to find the tombs of the Evil Champions, which rest in the Temple, evocate them and defeat all of them! Find the Artifact and escape from the Temple before all Evil creatures dwelling there wake up! Explore an ancient dungeon, avoid traps, kill monsters, challenge Bosses, grab treasures, gain Experience points, increase your character abilities.

Temple of Horrors is an innovative dungeon crawler game where typical Euro game mechanics mix with American style. The game can last up to 14 rounds. In every round, the opponents will be stronger and more challenging to win. Each Hero has their powers and abilities and can improve them during the game, gaining experience points, choosing how: by this way, each Hero is different in every game. Magic Items, potions, weapons will improve and differentiate each character more.

In ToH, players create the dungeon map directly, choosing which tile place from their available display when their Hero explores a new area. By creating large Rooms of the same type, players will increase their chances to find clues about the Artifact position. Placing (or not) particular game Rooms, from Library to Trap Rooms, or Treasure, Healing, Monster Rooms, will determine their chance of survival. Escape? Not so easy! After entering the Temple, the Entrance collapsed. So players must find a secondary exit. Different in each game, an ancient Map will reveal the path they have to take to find it.

Activating the Tombs Rooms, players will be able to fight mighty Bosses and find Clues. Combining Clues, they will discover the Artefact position, and if they will able to take it and escape from the Temple in time, they will win.

You can play the game also in PvP mode. In this case, one or more hidden players will try secretly to win alone, distract the rest of the party on a false path, and grab the Artifact. This kind of game adds a lot of RPG aspects to the game.

A set of a board and pieces for unspecified abstract strategy games. The board is printed on both sides and corresponds to the six sizes common in classic abstract games. As appendixes, it comes with the rules for five games in the public domain, Konane, Fox and Hounds, Tafl, Halma, Turkish Checkers, and author's three original games of Mabi, Tiptoe and Apart which can be played on this board.

Mayor Humdinger planned an Adventure City celebration that (as usual) has been ruined by a storm. Even worse, he's also putting lonely pups in obedience school! Use your mission card to see what items to find around city. Once the items are found, you can rescue the lovely pups!

Command the pride of the German Navy in Bismarck Solitaire, an Original Book-wargame by Worthington Publishing. Lead the German ships Bismarck, Prinz Eugen, and U-boat support as they take on the determined Royal Navy with one goal, Sink the Bismarck!

You have 8 missions of varying objectives and difficultly, plus two training cruises. Each mission gives you 3 tries to best the Royal Navy. Some missions require you to find convoys, others expect you to sink a few British warships, while some just hope your ships can survive the sortie.

Bismarck Solitaire is a pen and book wargame.  In the book you get a map and orders.  You roll dice to see events, move your ship, fight battles, and resolve events.  The only thing you must provide is 2 dice, a pen, and a sense of adventure.

A turn is this:

Roll 2 dice and cross reference it to a chart to see events.
Resolve the events.
Fight any battles.
Plot your movement on the map.

Each mission gives your victory conditions.  Once you obtain your victory conditions the game is over.  Play missions over and over as no two games are the same.
